intro.description: MetaPrint2D This tutorial describes the basic steps for using the MetaPrint2D feature of Bioclipse to predict metabolic sites in chemical structures.

item.title: Step 1: Open the MetaPrint2D Perspective
item.description:
The MetaPrint2D Perspective is a setup of the workbench which is suitable for the MetaPrint2D feature. It simply rearranges the visible Views.
In the top menu, select option Window > Open Perspective > Other... and in the dialog select the MetaPrint2D option.

item.title: Step 2: Open a chemical structure
item.description: In the Bioclipse Navigator, double-click a 2D chemical structure to open it in the 2D chemical editor. Running MetaPrint2D on 3D molecules is currently not supported.

item.title: Step 3: Run MetaPrint2D
item.description: In the MetaPrint2D toolbar are several buttons. Click on the leftmost, which says "Execute MetaPrint2D on the active molecule(s)" when hovered upon.

item.title: Step 4: Examine the results.
item.description:
MetaPrint2D visualizes the results in a normalized, relative fashion. This means the most likely atom to undergo metabolization is colored RED. Atoms colored ORANGE are moderately likely to undergo metabolization, atoms colored in GREEN are less likely, and atoms with no color have very low probability of metabolization starting in that place.
Hover over the atoms to see detailed results on the form: Number of hits in the reaction centre set, the total number of hits, and the normalized ratio.
It is possible to edit the molecule and then executing MetaPrint2D again to see the updated result. If you like to turn on automatic recalculation, click on the icon marked with blue arrows saying "Turn on automatic MetaPrint2D calculation". After, edit the molecule and notice how coloring changes as you edit.

item.title: Step 5: Run MetaPrint2D on multiple molecules
item.description: Open an SDFile with several molecules or click below to open a sample file.

item.title: Step 6: Run MetaPrint2D
item.description: As above, click the icon in the toolbar to run MetaPrint2D.

item.title: Step 7: Switch between tabs in the Molecules Table
item.description: Select one of the structures in the MoleculesTable and then click the tab Single Molecule at the bottom of the editor. Here you can edit the molecule and switch back to the tab Table as desired.

item.title: More information
item.description: This step concludes this tutorial. For more information, please refer to the Bioclipse Help system available from the top menu Help > Help Contents.
